BMW is reportedly working on a 1,000HP all-electric M5 that'll rival Tesla's Plaid Model S ...  says the vehicle will have a tri-motor setup, with two 250 kW motors at the rear, and one at the front. That will equate to 750 kW of electric power; that's around 1,006 horsepower in convetional terms. That drivetrain will be good for a 0-62 mph time of 2.9 seconds. Credit: Wikimedia - CC The current BMW M5 is powered by 4.9L V8 putting out around 600 bhp. The car is due a facelift next year, but after that its next model range could include an all-electric variant. Using pouch style batteries, rather than something similar to Tesla's cylindrical cells, the new M5 will have an estimated range of 435 miles (around 700 km). However, only after real world tests will we know a more accurate range figure. It will also be equipped with a 135 kW battery ...

Advertisement "We currently hold a market-weight view on the sector with preference towards the gold and diversified miners. Our preferred names are Polymetal and Saracen for gold while BHP is preferred over Rio Tinto out of the diversified miners," the analysts said. The sector took a breather on Tuesday, as BHP dropped 0.8 per cent to $35.41, and Rio Tinto lost 0.3 per cent to $96.97. Gold miner Evolution Mining fell 1.3 per cent to $6.22 after confirming it is evaluating the sale of its Cracow gold mine in Queensland. Iron ore boom is no silver bullet for the budget ... for Vale to win an injunction in court that allowed it to continue operating. Iron ore contributes to the federal budget through taxes on profits made by miners such as Rio Tinto and BHP, and Deloitte Access Economics associate director Cathryn Lee said iron ore would deliver billions more to the federal budget than was expected. ''The average iron ore price for the seven months ...  West Australian state government, which based its May 2019 budget on iron ore prices averaging $US73.50 per tonne in fiscal 2020. Iron ore is also largely responsible for the bumper dividends BHP, Rio and Fortescue Metals Group have paid over the past couple of years. Those three companies paid out $US7.91 billion ($11.75 billion) of dividends in October 2019, and a further $ ...

Australian shares up on further easing in coronavirus restrictions ... its ailing economy. The S&P/ASX 200 index rose 0.6% to 5,790.3 points by 0208 GMT, after losing some ground at the open as global market sentiment was tempered by fears of a resurgence of the coronavirus in the United States amid riots across many cities there. The benchmark, which fell 1.6% on Friday, was supported by miners. ASX 300 metals and mining index rose 1.71% with global miners BHP Group Ltd and Rio Tinto Ltd rising 2.6% and 2.8%, respectively. China's most-active Dalian iron ore contract rose as much as 3.3% in early trade. Gold stocks were also up 0.33% in tandem with higher spot prices, with Bellevue Gold Ltd, up 7.06%, and Alacer Gold Corp, gaining 5.56% Financial stocks rose 0.59% led by Bendigo and Adelaide Bank Ltd, up 2.44%, followed by ...

Australian shares drop, ACCC probes Qantas takeover of rival airline ...  (AEST), the benchmark ASX 200 index was down 0.8 per cent to 5,709 points. The Australian dollar has risen (+0.5pc) to 66.96 US cents, around its highest value since mid-February. Banking stocks were the biggest drag on the market, with steep losses for Commonwealth Bank (-1.8pc), Westpac (-2.6pc), ANZ (-2.3pc) and NAB (-2.7pc). Surging commodity prices have boosted the mining giants BHP (+1.1pc), Rio Tinto (+1.3pc) and Fortescue Metals (+1.3pc). The iron ore price has surged by 5.5 per cent to $US102.39 a tonne. Spot gold has lifted moderately (+0.8pc) to $US1,739.21 an ounce, while Brent crude oil has fallen slightly (-0.2pc) to $US37.75 per barrel. Surging iron ore price to support ASX ...  China or not." JPMorgan Asset Management's Kerry Craig: "The wild card is the politics between Australia and China, and whether iron ore shipments will be held up in China or not." The price of iron ore has risen sharply through May, and was up 21.8 per cent for the month. However, the major mining stocks on the ASX have lagged that recovery. Over the past month, BHP rose 7.1 per cent, Rio Tinto firmed 6.7 per cent and Fortescue Metals Group advanced 16.2 per cent. In the past two weeks, investors have shown an appetite for some of the market's under-loved and undervalued stocks , bidding up the banks and travel stocks in a search for value. But that attention could now turn to the major miners, analysts said. "The equity rotation is ...

Robert Anderson ... 27 min ago Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Save ANDERSON, Robert "Andy" went to his heavenly home May 3, 2020. He was born on March 29, 1943 to Andrew and Alice Anderson in Iron River, Michigan. He attended local schools. He married Charlene (Christofferson) his wife of 54 years in 1965 and moved to Tucson, Arizona in 1969. He worked at Magma Copper/BHP for 28 years until his retirement. He enjoyed his two little doggies, hunting, fishing, camping, golfing and family get togethers. He was a kind and generous man and very loving husband, father and grandfather. He was preceded in death by his parents, infant twin sisters and father-in-law. He will be sadly missed by his wife, Charlene; son, Mark (Jennifer); daughter, Michele (Michael) Fiscus ...
